intl_travel.Notes: "Per the latest Argentine government policy, most foreigners who are not a resident in Argentina, including U.S. citizens, will not be permitted to enter Argentina; the U.S. Embassy is not aware of an estimated end date for this travel ban."    "Argentine authorities are implementing a “tourism pilot program” for citizens and residents of bordering countries traveling to the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area for tourism.  This program does not apply to the United States.  In addition to the sworn statement required of all passengers entering Argentina, persons entering under this pilot program must also present a negative COVID-19 PCR test within the 72 hours before travel and proof of medical insurance for COVID-19 that covers hospitalization or isolation for the duration of their stay in Argentina. Travelers under the program  must enter Argentina at Ministro Pistarini Ezeiza International Airport, San Fernando International Airport, or the Buquebus Ferry Terminal in Buenos Aires.  As Argentine authorities are still finalizing the details of this pilot program, persons who believe they meet its requirements should contact Argentine immigration directly.  The U.S. Department of State continues to advise against all travel to Argentina, and the Level 4 “Do Not Travel” advisory for Argentina remains in effect."    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

intl_travel.Notes: Since November 8th, a mandatory quarantine of ten days has been in effect for all people entering from risk areas. The quarantine can be shortened if travelers can present a negative corona test no earlier than the fifth day after arrival.  There are no pandemic-related restrictions for entry from the other member states of the European Union as well as from the United Kingdom, Switzerland, Liechtenstein, Norway and Iceland. The current entry restrictions relate to entries from third countries.    However, the respective infection protection regulations of the federal states (including with regard to quarantine and reporting obligations) as well as the obligation to digitally register for entry must be observed by all people entering from risk areas.    Für Personen, die in anderen als den vorstehend genannten Drittstaaten ansässig sind, gelten die bisherigen Einreisebeschränkungen fort, d.h. sie dürfen nur nach Deutschland einreisen, wenn sie eine wichtige Funktion ausüben oder ihre Reise zwingend notwendig ist (siehe hierzu "Wann ist die zwingende Notwendigkeit der Einreise gegeben?"). Ansässig ist eine Person in einem Staat, wenn sie dort entweder ihren Wohnsitz oder ihren gewöhnlichen Aufenthalt hat. Ein Wohnsitz ist insbesondere dann begründet, wenn die letzten 6 Monate dort verbracht wurden.  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.zusammengegencorona.de/informieren/alltag-gestalten/#faqitem=e2df90f7-8f7a-5c51-b42f-ecaffbcfe5f9  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207221431/https://www.bmi.bund.de/SharedDocs/faqs/DE/themen/bevoelkerungsschutz/coronavirus/coronavirus-faqs.html;jsessionid=36F79BE0E1058BB7E14840089EE197C4.1_cid373
dom_move.Notes: The federal and state governments call for unnecessary trips and visits to be avoided.  According to the decision taken by the Federal and Länder Governments, from 2 November until at least 20 December hotels and other accommodation providers may only provide overnight accommodation to people whose travel is essential. It is no longer permitted to provide overnight accommodation for tourism purposes. Visas for tourism purposes will thus only be issued in exceptional cases. It is expected that these restrictions will be in place until at least early January 2021.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207220918/https://www.zusammengegencorona.de/informieren/alltag-gestalten/

stayhome.Notes: People are expected to stay within small groups (see below), wear a mask and keep distance, but there are currently no restrictions to only leave the house for necessary reasons.  Staying in public is only permitted with the members of your own household and of another household and has been limited to a maximum of 5 people since December 1st. Citizens are also asked to refrain from private trips and visits. From December 1st, private get-togethers with friends, relatives and acquaintances are only permitted with members of your own household and those of another household, a maximum of five people may come together.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207221252/https://www.zusammengegencorona.de/en/inform/organising-everyday-life/
gathering.Notes: According to the resolution of November 25th, a stricter contact restriction applies. Citizens are asked to reduce contact with other people outside of their own household to "an absolutely necessary minimum". The members of your own household and of another household may be in public together. The upper limit is 5 people from December 1st. Please also note the requirements in your region. In general, limit your private celebrations and stick to the AHA + L formula: keep your distance (1.5 meters), observe hygiene rules and wear everyday masks. Regular ventilation applies indoors. Also, note the rules in your state.
public_transport.Notes: The federal and state governments call for unnecessary travel to be avoided in general. This also includes unnecessary journeys in public transport. Please wear an everyday mask on the S-Bahn and trains, in the train station, on the platform and at the stops as well as on the airport premises and on the plane. The minimum distance of 1.5 meters to travelers and staff should always be observed. Deutsche Bahn provides many tips on safe travel on its website. Unnecessary queues, e.g. B. in front of the on-board toilet can be avoided. The respective national hygiene regulations apply when getting on and off and at the airports. In general, please adhere to the rules of conduct that are summarized in the AHA formula (distance, hygiene rules, everyday mask). In this way, everyone can make a contribution while traveling to contain the spread of the new type of coronavirus. This formula is supplemented by A for app (the Corona warning app helps to break chains of infection) and L for ventilation.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207220918/https://www.zusammengegencorona.de/informieren/alltag-gestalten/

intl_travel.Notes: Testing / Screening on arrival  Prior to departure, passengers travelling to Nigeria must complete the on-line pre-boarding health declaration at the Nigeria International Travel Portal. They must also have tested negative for COVID-19 within 120 hours of their departure to Nigeria, and have uploaded their PCR test certificate to the on-line Travel Portal. Passengers must also carry evidence of the test and result when they travel. Only a COVID-19 PCR test is acceptable to the Nigerian authorities. Also before travel, passengers must book and pay for a repeat PCR test for day 7 of their arrival in Nigeria at the Nigeria International Travel Portal– evidence of the booking will be required on arrival. On arrival all passengers will be screened by Port Health Officials and be required to provide full contact details, including their address in Nigeria.    You should not use the NHS testing service to get a test in order to facilitate your travel to another country. You should arrange to take a private test.    Quarantine requirements  All new arrivals are expected to self-isolate at one location in the city of their arrival until the result of their second PCR test (which should be taken on day 7 of arrival) is known. If the second test is negative individuals can exit self-isolation from day 8 onwards. Anyone that has developed symptoms of coronavirus during their travel or later tests positive will be managed according to national guidelines for COVID-19 treatment. This may require quarantine at a government-monitored treatment centre.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201205151219/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/nigeria/entry-requirements

gathering.Notes: Targeted lockdowns across the country are preventing public events or gatherings.  The local government in Pakistan Administered Kashmir, aka Azaad Kashmir, imposed a strict 15-day lockdown starting on Nov 20 2020. As per the Geo New article: "Public gatherings, including weddings, have been banned."  Similarly, in "Khyber Pakhtunkhwa: All major public gathering have been banned. Legal action will be taken in case of violations."   Such reporting suggests that public events in targeted/specific regions within the country have be halted/banned. source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201129201909/https://www.geo.tv/latest/320263-what-are-the-covid-19-restrictions-in-pakistan    In general, the Pakistan Government issued guidance on public gatherings such as weddings for crowd sizes as small as 25 people. Broadly such guidance suggests that "No indoor gatherings are permitted, and only outdoor wedding events are allowed, in which number of the guests must not exceed 300 individuals with mandatory arrangements for seating  of each individual at-least 6 feet apart. event timing should be restricted to 2 hours with closure evening timing at 10 PM" Source: https://covid.gov.pk/new_guidelines/28November2020_20201127_Additional_Guidelines_for_Marriage_Events_Ceremonies_during_COVID_19_4505.pdf    Additionally, the guidelines provide clear space restrictions for specific crowd sizes. E.g. for a gathering of upto 25 people, there should be at least 900 sq feet of space; for crowds of upto 100 people a minimum of 3600 sq ft. is required.    While the guidance document is date Nov 27th 2020, it also states that "These guidelines will be implemented from 20th November 2020 onwards in urban centers (Karachi, Lahore, Islamabad, Rawalpindi, Multan, Hyderabad, Gilgit,  Muzaffarabad, Mirpur, Peshawar, Quetta, Gujranwala, Gujrat, Faisalabad, Bahawalpur & Swat)".

gathering.Notes: There is a ban on public gatherings of over 8 people. However, the restrictions for gatherings are part of the Public Order Act and explicitly only for *public* gatherings (as cited in the C3 notes), not *private* gatherings under the definition of C4. There is no policy for private gatherings for 2 reasons. First, the rationale of the Swedish government is that it is better to issue recommendations and call on people to follow these and be responsible voluntarily, rather than impose them through legislation. With respect to gatherings, most Swedish regions have recommendations in place which ask everyone to refrain from close contact with people they don't live with and non-essential visits to indoor environments like shops, gyms, and museums, all of which are not covered under the Public Order Act. Prime Minister Stefan Löfven has said that "it's not possible to legislate common sense" but has also made clear that the rules for gathering under the Public Order Act should also set a "norm" for private gatherings, urging people to cancel dinners, parties and trips to gyms or libraries, but these kinds of gatherings are not covered by legislation. A second reason is that the Swedish constitution in its current form does not allow for limits on the number of people who meet privately.     See eg: https://web.archive.org/web/20201130183955/https://www.thelocal.se/20201116/breaking-sweden-introduces-limit-of-eight-coronavirus
